abstract: Christopher B Epps, former commissioner of Mississippi Corrections Dept, and onetime lawmaker Cecil McCrory plead guilty to corruption charges involving state contracts with private prisons industry.; federal inquiry has sparked calls for investigation into Mississippi's process for awarding state contracts and has raised questions about use of private prisons.
lead_paragraph: The former head of the state’s prison system and a onetime lawmaker entered guilty pleas as part of an agreement with federal prosecutors.

headline.main: 2 Former Mississippi Officials Plead Guilty in a Graft Case Involving Private Prisons
headline.print_headline: 2 Former Mississippi Officials Plead Guilty in a Graft Case Involving Private Prisons

snippet: The former head of the state’s prison system and a onetime lawmaker entered guilty pleas as part of an agreement with federal prosecutors.
